tasks.task_description: Implement command recognition system to avoid unnecessary AI calls
Create response caching layer for AI responses
Fix architecture issues with dependency injection

description: Continue with Phase 2 improvements - implementing command recognition, caching, architecture fixes, and performance optimizations to reduce AI dependency and improve responsiveness
context: Created CommandRecognizer.js to identify direct shell commands and bypass AI processing, ResponseCache.js for LRU caching of AI responses with TTL, and ServiceContainer.js for dependency injection management

Created StateManager.js for centralized state management, updated CommandExecutor with direct command execution bypass, created PerformanceMonitor.js for tracking metrics, and integrated all components in main.js with command recognition, caching, and performance monitoring

Completed error handling standardization by enhancing ErrorBoundary.js with comprehensive error handling, recovery strategies, and memory management. Created performance test suite in __tests__/performance/performance.test.js to validate command recognition speed, caching efficiency, and overall performance improvements. Phase 2 improvements are now complete with significant performance optimizations implemented.
